title: BlockchainWizard
author: BlockchainWizard
content: As a Blockchain Wizard, I'm convinced: Bitcoin is magic internet money. Bitcoin might be not really money – but it's internet money. And it's not just internet money, it's magic internet money. We can attribute a lot of characteristics to Bitcoin but we really need to realize at some point, how magical Bitcoin is as an internet money. Bitcoin has a magical history, where it’s even unknown, who developed it. It's already very magical because probably, we will never know, who Satoshi Nakamoto really is. But for sure, he was a really good coder, who inventecd Bitcoin. And Bitcoin doesn't really exist, it's just code and we can "see" it in our wallet, we can't touch it like real cash, because it's only 0 or 1 (or hashs). But still, we can own it, when we own our private key, where we can access it in Bitcoin's Blockchain, what's really magical and we can even send it to someone else in a completely different country to a different address, what’s even more magical. A Blockchain is a very magical invention because such a product is still very new and unknown for many people. Bitcoin is magic internet money because it can't be faked as well and Bitcoin follows defined rules. For example, Bitcoin's limited supply of 21 millions of BTC and how all Bitcoins are mined during several cycles until 2140, still more than 100 years away, when all Bitcoins will be mined. So, Bitcoin is not only magic internet money, it’s also scarce internet money. What's even better: everyone can join us.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: BlockchainWizard on October 29, 2023, 02:44:14 PMAs a Blockchain Wizard, I'm convinced: Bitcoin is magic internet money.For me Bitcoin is not a type that can be said to be magical, Bitcoin in my opinion is not something surprising, strange, etc., Bitcoin is a type of cryptocurrency that I know is used cryptographically, even though it has no physical properties, but it can be stored and accessed transparently, the notes are encrypted just like you store notes online.Or in today's language it is digital or can be said in the form of valuable assets which are provided in exchange by rail for cash or goods, even though they have to be distributed via a public blockchain network as is done currently, for me it is not magical, maybe if you say Bitcoin is anonymous and mysterious it might make sense, just like the title given by many people to its creator Satoshi Nakamoto.

So is your money in your banks — only a small minority is actually backed by physical bank notes.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: For a number of decades, all attempts to develop a digital currency has failed. Satoshi learned from all of them and finally developed a perfectly working version. Well, that's indeed a little magical. Of all the desirable traits of a hard and sound money, no single fiat currency has met them. Bitcoin came and offered durability, divisibility, scarcity, transparency, fungibility, being a store of value, and other characteristics of an ideal money. That seems magical as well. But Bitcoin is real money. It isn't magic. Its creation follows a strict protocol. It isn't like how fiat is created, magically out of thin air representing nothing whatsoever.

And it's popularity is showing that it will be a dominant currency in the entire world.

But I assume that @BlockchainWizard called Bitcoin a magical internet money because it couldn't be touched but it could be transferred and used as a means of exchange. This is not magical anymore because even fiat can be transferred through the same means even through the blockchain in the form of CBDC. Bitcoin is People's money, if one day we face a dictator who freezes all access to the fiat we have, then we will still have Bitcoin for transactions. we can buy using bitcoin. comments.author: michellee
comments.body: There is no magic in Bitcoin without doing something. You must buy Bitcoin, search for free satoshi from the faucet, or work for Bitcoin. Without all of that, you can't have Bitcoin. But Bitcoin is money that exists on the internet and can also be used as a means of payment offline. But it depends on each country.But we should not use the word magic for Bitcoin because we are afraid that people will think that by having Bitcoin, they can get rich quickly in an instant. But if people buy Bitcoin and keep it for a few years, they can make a profit from investing in Bitcoin.But unfortunately, until now, there are still many people who don't know much about Bitcoin and don't want to start investing in Bitcoin. So those of us who already know Bitcoin must increase the amount of Bitcoin we have. This is so that when Bitcoin becomes a means of payment for all countries, we will already have Bitcoin and be ready with everything.

comments.author: Tuturtinular
comments.body: I don't think bitcoin is something magical that was created magically and just happened. I read a little about the long history before bitcoin was born and discovered a new conception of a decentralized financial system as the antithesis of centralized fiat money.Bitcoin initially had a cheap price and over time it became more expensive. It didn't just happen, many things happened to bitcoin, many rejections and bans on bitcoin, all of these were obstacles that bitcoin faced until bitcoin finally became as popular as it is now. Bitcoin is both a currency and an asset, it is loved for the concept of freedom it brings. We can own bitcoins individually and no one can freeze our bitcoins as long as we keep them in our own wallets, not on an exchange.Bitcoin is a breakthrough, an idea, and freedom. Bitcoin was born with hard work and challenges, so Bitcoin runs normally and there is no magic except the great concept that exists in Bitcoin

comments.author: Zigabel
comments.body: Association magic with Bitcoin sounds like it's something that can't be properly deciphered and has some mysterious element meanwhile on the contrary Bitcoin is a very understandable and clear financial asset, which anybody who dedicates their rime to understanding it will definitely understand it properly and see no mystery in it because it's transparent without any form of vaugenesss.In as much as I understand your concept it's also important you put things in a more clear and original form to avoid any case of ambiguity from people who are been introduced to such concept for the first time so they don't get a narrative not intended. Bitcoin may not appear to be physical, but it's pool of value is unending, it's virtuality is no barrier to its store of value and can even be further explored to a more innovative store of value. Bitcoin is so valuable that associating it with such description as given by the OP sounds like it's a mere virtual mystery, contrarily it's beyond that, Bitcoin is real business and everything about Bitcoin is now real than ever before.

comments.author: Winterfrost
comments.body: Bitcoin is the internet of money of all things. The swift transaction that can be performed on the blockchain, high security level without a security guard and price change at any specific time interval makes it invincible and more magical. What interest me the most is the trust and belief people have for such a digital money that you cant feel or touch, its really amazing. Although the feeling that Bitcoin is magical gives the belief that it will always going to make people rich which is not true at all times. Bitcoin can get as high and as well as very low. What should be considered is the fact that, when the knowledge of it is applied either by investing and the idea of holding it for some decade can give hope of a better future if you do not sell when the price gives you a little profit or panic sell when the price drops because it is volatile.
